entry.title: Roseburg City Council discusses the downtown parking problem
entry.summary: More questions were asked than answered in Roseburg City Council’s downtown parking workshop Wednesday as council worked through and debated various ideas of how to solve a sizable funding shortfall.

entry.title: Woman allegedly embezzled $200k from employer, under investigation since August
entry.summary: Lacey Neal Ott, 42, of Winchester, was arrested by the Roseburg Police Department at approximately 3 p.m. Oct. 16 for allegedly stealing over $200,000 from her employer via the company payroll system.

entry.title: Wildland Firefighting fair hosted at Phoenix School
entry.summary: In an effort to entice more people to join the fight fires, Oregon Conservation Corps of the Umpqua Valley held a Wildland Firefighter Job Fair on Thursday afternoon at the Phoenix School of Roseburg.

entry.title: New battalion chiefs and promoted fire lieutenants at Sutherlin Fire Department
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Sutherlin Fire Department announced its hiring of two battalion chiefs and promotion of three volunteer fire lieutenants Monday.

entry.summary: For big game hunters planning on bagging a deer or elk, precautions must be taken to keep Oregon free of chronic wasting disease this hunting season.

entry.title: Tags required to keep hunt legal
entry.summary: OREGON — Oregon State Police Fish and Wildlife Division is reminding hunters that to keep their hunt legal, valid big game tags are required for hunters.

entry.title: Local child wins champion at American Royal
entry.summary: A 10-year-old Dixonville resident won the grand champion market goat division at the 124th American Royal Livestock Show in Kansas City, Missouri.

entry.title: VA Deputy Secretary visits Roseburg as a part of listening tour
entry.summary: Newly appointed Veterans Affairs Deputy Secretary Tanya Bradsher toured the Roseburg VA Medical Center on Wednesday to hear from VA staff about the health care records system that local veterans have been frustrated with for more than a year.

entry.title: Autumn weather moves into the Umpqua Valley
entry.summary: Across Douglas County, temperatures have dropped, precipitation has increased and the leaves have begun to change color, signaling the beginning of the fall season.

entry.title: Family of drowned teen sues local, state agencies for $20M
entry.summary: A $20 million dollar lawsuit was filed against the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office, Douglas County, Oregon State Marine Board, State of Oregon and Deputy Darrell Norton in the death of 15-year-old Myles Martin Swenson.
